description: This file provides an abstraction for real-time subscriptions using Supabase in the SpendSense frontend. It manages configuration retrieval, logging, and connection handling for transaction insertion events, supporting both active and no-op modes based on environment variables.

methods.name: getLogLevel()
methods.description: Retrieves and normalizes the logging level from environment variables.

methods.name: shouldDebug()
methods.description: Determines if debug level logging is enabled based on the log level.

methods.name: shouldInfo()
methods.description: Determines if info level logging is enabled based on the log level.

methods.name: debugLog(...args)
methods.description: Logs debug messages if debug level is enabled.

methods.name: infoLog(...args)
methods.description: Logs info messages if info level is enabled.

methods.name: warnLog(...args)
methods.description: Logs warning messages unless the log level is set to 'silent'.

methods.name: getSupabaseConfig()
methods.description: Retrieves Supabase URL and anon key from environment or window variables and indicates if both are available.

methods.name: createNoopClient()
methods.description: Creates a no-operation client that logs info when subscription is attempted but does not perform real subscriptions.

methods.name: createSupabaseRealtimeClient(url, anonKey)
methods.description: Creates a real-time client connected to Supabase, managing the subscription lifecycle to the 'transactions' table and handling incoming insert events.

methods.name: createRealtimeClient()
methods.description: Factory function that returns a real-time client, either active or no-op, based on available configuration.
